results.title: Anglo-Saxon England
results.brief_description: An outline of the history of Britain from the end of the Roman rule (A.D. 410) to the coming of the Normans (A.D. 1066), incorporating the results of recent archaeological research. Includes migrations from the Anglo-Saxon homelands, Saxon communities and craftsmanship, the early churches and Christianity, Viking attacks, King Alfred, the formation of England, revival of learning, Canute, Trelleborg and trade with the Continent.

results.title: Angles on an arc
results.brief_description: Gives proof of the theorem which states that the measure of the angle at the centre of a circle subtended by an arc is twice the measure of the angle at the circle subtended by the same arc.

results.title: Angles
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Jean Nunn
results.brief_description: This film shows how to calculate angles, heights and distances using formulae, and provides practical applications such as the felling of a tree and the radius and distance walked by a horse during training. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Angler's island
results.brief_description: Trout fishing in Tasmania. Trout were released into Tasmanian streams a century ago, and anglers fish in many places with historical associations. Trout are caught, stripped and the young raised in hatcheries to re-stock streams. Shannon Rise during the caddis moth season and the lonely lakes in western Tasmania are favourite haunts for anglers.

results.title: Angle Bay
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Aselwood Productions and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: Angle Bay lies on the southern shore of Milford Haven in Pembrokshire. A scenic and historical impression of this ancient land is given, and the film then reverts to the present day, for Angle Bay is now an ocean terminal and Milford Haven a deep-water harbour for oil tankers. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Angklung orchestra
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Morris and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
An Angklung is a Javanese bamboo instrument which is rattled to produce a fixed note. Originally tuned to the pentatonic scale it was used in traditional music. However, today it is usually tuned to the diatonic scale and Western-style music is performed. In this film the Bandung Conservatorium Orchestra demonstrates the complexity of the instrument and plays a well-known waltz.

results.title: Angiosperms: the flowering plants
results.brief_description: The flowering plants called angiosperms, the dominant form of terrestrial plant life, are adapted to great extremes of temperature and moisture and range geographically from the arctic zones to the tropics. Shows the structural and reproductive characteristics which distinguish them from other plants. Traces the processes of pollination, formation of seeds and fruit, seed dispersal, and plant growth.

results.title: Angi Vera
results.creator_credit: Mafilm, Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat and Pal Gabor
results.brief_description: Stalinist Hungary, 1948. A young nurse, honest enough to criticise the conditions in the hospital where she works, is singled out by the party for political training. Gabor’s understated drama follows her transformation from a relatively naive eighteen year-old into a cool political operator, her integrity traded for a position in the Party. The film objectively critiques the years of oppressive Stalinist dogma in Hungary, leaving the viewer to draw his or her own conclusion. Based on the novel by Endre Veszi. Cast includes Veronika Pap, Erzsi Pasztor, Eva Szabo and Tamas Dunai. In Hungarian with English subtitles.
